briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon, everyone. I will now begin the climate briefing for 2026-02-28.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Worsening Impacts of Climate Change and Urgent Warnings
sections.content: News released today contains serious impacts of climate change and urgent warnings regarding them. Many countries are warning of an 'extreme heatwave' expected this summer [6], and new research indicates that mountain soils in arid regions could emit more greenhouse gases due to climate change [24]. In particular, an analysis suggests that blizzards in 2026 intensified to a 'blockbuster level' due to climate change [20], and data showing shorter winters in 80% of major U.S. cities [26] illustrates the paradox of global warming, with '9-day shorter winters' and record-breaking cold snaps occurring simultaneously in 195 U.S. cities [3]. Furthermore, the impacts of climate change are manifesting in various forms, including unexpected ecological changes such as a decrease in avalanches due to the climate crisis [2] and an increase in giant sinkholes threatening Turkish farmers [27]. This suggests that we are facing a climate crisis era where we must choose 'future scenarios' [1].

sections.title: âš ï¸ Concerns over Retreat in International Climate Policy
sections.content: Internationally, movements that backtrack on climate change response have been observed, raising serious concerns. The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has withdrawn its endangerment finding for greenhouse gases and decided to abolish greenhouse gas emission standards for all vehicles [23]. Additionally, there have been reports that the Trump administration is deleting climate change-related data [19]. These actions could pose significant obstacles to international efforts to combat climate change and undermine the urgency of global climate crisis response, thus issuing a serious warning.

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Domestic Efforts for Carbon Neutrality and Renewable Energy Transition
sections.content: Domestically, various efforts are underway to accelerate the realization of carbon neutrality and the transition to renewable energy. Incheon City is accelerating carbon neutrality practices in the public sector [11], and the Yeongam-gun Sustainable Development Council has approved articles of association for resource circulation and carbon neutrality practices [10]. Chungcheongbuk-do Province is accelerating its transition to hydrogen and renewable energy [14], and in Jeollabuk-do Province, various entities are joining forces to expand renewable energy [15]. Corporate participation is also active, with Hyundai Department Store including its own eco-friendly activities in the Carbon Neutrality Point System [9], and a plan to award carbon neutrality points for purchasing products made with recycled materials is also being linked [8]. Representative Ahn Ho-young of the Democratic Party of Korea evaluated Hyundai Motor's Saemangeum investment as an achievement of hydrogen and renewable energy strategies, emphasizing the importance of securing implementation capabilities [17, 18].

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Trends in Climate Crisis Adaptation and Technological Innovation
sections.content: Adaptation efforts and technological innovation in response to the climate crisis are also emerging as important trends. In Gyeongbuk Province, the 2026 Peach Pest and Disease Surveillance Team is fully operational, strengthening the on-site network for climate crisis response [4], and K-water is advancing its response to green algae amidst the climate crisis [5]. Technologically, Nambu Power is seeking to preempt the safety market by unveiling renewable energy inspection technology utilizing artificial intelligence (AI) and drones [16], and India is accelerating its carbon neutrality goals with the groundbreaking of eco-friendly data centers [13]. Meanwhile, the issue that electric vehicle fires are difficult to extinguish with existing fire suppression systems was raised in parliamentary discussions on energy legislation [12], indicating that it is time to also consider safety challenges associated with the introduction of new technologies. On a positive note, there are also observations that several species are showing flexibility in adapting to climate change [25].

sections.title: ğŸŒ Climate Governance and Legal, Ethical Discussions
sections.content: Discussions on governance and legal, ethical approaches to climate change are also actively underway. Domestically, the Presidential Committee on Climate Crisis Response plays a crucial role in climate governance [7]. Internationally, the concept of applying the 'One Health bioethics principle' to climate change as a 'planetary patient paradigm' has been proposed [21], and it is noteworthy that situations where climate change is addressed in court are occurring [22]. This suggests that climate change is recognized as a complex issue that goes beyond mere environmental concerns, demanding legal accountability and ethical considerations.

briefing.closing: Today's briefing has highlighted a complex situation where the severe impacts of climate change intersect with domestic and international efforts to address them. This is a time that demands continuous vigilance and action. This concludes today's climate briefing.

articles.description: Falling groundwater, extreme heat and water-intensive farming are accelerating land collapse, forcing a rethink in agricultural practicesFatih Sik was drinking tea with friends at home when he heard a rumbling sound outside that grew to a loud boom, like a volcano had erupted nearby.
